item.title: The twin brushstrokes of my marriage and career
item.description: I remember the day that I fell in love with teaching. A few weeks into my first graduate school experience as a teaching assistant, I stood in front of a sunlit classroom brushing the chalk off my jeans and looked at my students. No clacks of fingers on keyboards, no eyes glued to screensâ€“just small nods, smiles as understanding finally came. Statistics has a bad reputation for being dry and challenging (“You teach statistics?
